solution_line_template: He uses {packets_per_cup} packet per cup of coffee and he has {cups_per_day} cups a day so that's {packets_per_cup}*{cups_per_day} = <<{packets_per_cup}*{cups_per_day}={packets_per_day}>>{packets_per_day} packets

He wants enough to last him {num_days} days and he uses {packets_per_day} packets a day so that's {num_days}*{packets_per_day} = <<{num_days}*{packets_per_day}={total_packets}>>{total_packets} packets

The packets come {packets_per_box} to a box and he needs {total_packets} packets so that's {total_packets}/{packets_per_box} = <<{total_packets}/{packets_per_box}={num_boxes}>>{num_boxes} boxes of sugar substitute
Each box costs ${cost_per_box}.00 and he needs {num_boxes} boxes so that's {cost_per_box}*{num_boxes} = $<<{cost_per_box}*{num_boxes}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
